title: VCVTTPS2UDQ — Convert with Truncation Packed Single-Precision Floating-Point Values to Packed Unsigned Doubleword Integer Values

fields.name: Instruction Modes
fields.value:
`VCVTTPS2UDQ xmm1 {k1}{z}, xmm2/m128/m32bcst`
`VCVTTPS2UDQ ymm1 {k1}{z}, ymm2/m256/m32bcst`
`VCVTTPS2UDQ zmm1 {k1}{z}, zmm2/m512/m32bcst{sae}`

fields.name: Description
fields.value: Converts with truncation packed single-precision floating-point values in the source operand to sixteen unsigned doubleword integers in the destination operand.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: When a conversion is inexact, the value returned is rounded according to the rounding control bits in the MXCSR. If a converted result cannot be represented in the destination format, the floating-point invalid exception is raised, and if this exception is masked, the integer value 2w – 1 is returned, where w represents the number of bits in the destination format.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: EVEX encoded versions: The source operand is a ZMM/YMM/XMM register, a 512/256/128-bit memory location or a 512/256/128-bit vector broadcasted from a 32-bit memory location. The destination operand is a ZMM/YMM/XMM register conditionally updated with writemask k1.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: Note: EVEX.vvvv is reserved and must be 1111b otherwise instructions will #UD.

footer.text: Thanks to Felix Cloutier for the online x86 reference
